comments:
I seem to get this exception when I try to create a connection. Seems like the visibility or access restrictions imposed by eclipse classloader changed somewhere along the line; possibly by Export-Packages decl.

Hey Brian could you look at this.  I couldn't duplicate it in my debug environment.  Could you give it a test using the binaries?  Thanks, Rob.

Hey Anthos,

Nobody here can reproduce this problem.  Could you please provide details as to how to reproduce the problem?

Thanks,
Rob

Today, I performed a clean install of Europa, and tried for the first time to set up Database Connections using DPT.

I get the error described in this bug report when I create a driver for Microsoft SQL Server using either the MS supplied jars or the jDTS jar from Sourceforge (http://jtds.sourceforge.net/).

Note that the driver does get created and seems to be usable.

Another note.  I did not get this error when I added my DB2 and Oracle Driver definitions.

In all cases, I had to point update each driver definition with the location of the jar file(s) for that definition.

Yet another note.

I just added the jDTS driver as a Generic JDBC Driver, and it did not display the error pop-up.

This may be an issue that is specific to the "SQL Server" Driver Definitions (under both 2000 and 2005 and using either the "Microsoft SQL Server 200x Driver for JDBC" or the "Other Driver" template.

I also seem to be experiencing a problem matching Mike McAngus's (Comment 4, Comment 5, Comment 6).  In other words, I'm using a new install of europa (JEE edition) and trying to setup an MSSQL connection using JTDS.

traces.message: Plug-in oracle.dbtools.connectivity was unable to load class org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.ui.PasswordTextPropertyDescriptor.
